isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - ENGINE CONTROL SYSTEM OVERVIEW - INJECTION CONTROL PRESSURE SYSTEM - Injection Pressure Control

svcproc.title: Injection Pressure Control
svcproc.para: The Electronic Control Module (ECM) controls the injection control pressure by operating the Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR). Injection control pressure is continuously monitored by the ECM using the Injection Control Pressure sensor (ICP). The pressure signal from the ICP allows the ECM to know the actual injection control pressure. This operation is known as Closed Loop.

Diagnostic codes can be set by the ECM if the ICP electrical signal is out of range, or if the ICP signal received corresponds to an out of range value for the injection control pressure at a given operating condition.
If these conditions occur, the ECM will ignore the ICP signal and control the IPR valve from programmed default values. This is called Open Loop Operation.
